generalfeedback.text:
1. True.
  2. True.
  3. True.
  4. False. You also need to estimate starting obrevation \(\ell_0\) and variance of the error term \(\sigma^2\)

answer.text: Forecast 10 steps ahead for ETS(ANN) is the last observation
Formally there are 30 options for ETS model
To estimate ETS(ANN) model you only need to estimate one parameter in the trend component \(\ell_t\)

feedback.text: False. You also need to estimate starting obrevation \(\ell_0\) and variance of the error term \(\sigma^2\)

generalfeedback.text:
1. True.
  2. True.
  3. False. It can!
  4. False. It’s better to use model with multiplicative seasonality

answer.text: In long run in model with damped trend the trend disappears
If the seasonal oscillation amplitude is increasing over time you can use Box-Cox transformation
Trend in ETS model can’t be negative
If the seasonal oscillation amplitude is decreasing over time it’s better to use ETS without seasonal component

feedback.text: False. It’s better to use model with multiplicative seasonality

questiontext.text:
How many parameters should be estimated in ETS(MAdM) with 4 seasons?

\(\begin{array}{l c r}{y_{t}=(\ell_{t-1}+\phi b_{t-1})s_{t-m}(1+\varepsilon_{t})}\\ {\ell_{t}=(\ell_{t-1}+\phi b_{t-1})(1+\alpha\varepsilon_{t})}\\ {b_{t}=\phi b_{t-1}+\beta(\ell_{t-1}+\phi b_{t-1})\varepsilon_{t}}\\ {s_{t}=s_{t-m}(1+\gamma\varepsilon_{t})}&{}\end{array}\)

generalfeedback.text: 4 model parameters + variance of the error term + (6-1) starting observations

questiontext.text:
Match ETS models with their formulas:

A:

\(\begin{array}{l}{{y_{t}=\ell_{t-1}+\phi b_{t-1}+\varepsilon_{t}}}\\ {{\ell_{t}=\ell_{t-1}+\phi b_{t-1}+\alpha\varepsilon_{t}}}\\ {{b_{t}=\phi b_{t-1}+\beta\varepsilon_{t}}}\end{array}\)

B:

\(\begin{array}{l c r}{{y_{t}=\ell_{t-1}s_{t-m}+\varepsilon_{t}}}\\ {{\ell_{t}=\ell_{t-1}+\alpha\varepsilon_{t}/s_{t-m}}}\\ {{s_{t}=s_{t-m}+\gamma\varepsilon_{t}/\ell_{t-1}}}\end{array}\)

s C:

\(\begin{array}{c}{{y_{t}=\mathcal{E}_{t-1}\left(1+\mathcal{E}_{t}\right)}}\\ {{\ell_{t}=\ell_{t-1}\left(1+\alpha\mathcal{E}_{t}\right)}}\end{array}\)

D:

\(\begin{array}{l c r}{y_{t}=(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1}+s_{t-m})(1+\varepsilon_{t})}\\ {\ell_{t}=\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1}+\alpha(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1}+s_{t-m})\varepsilon_{l}}\\ {b_{t}=b_{t-1}+\beta(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1}+s_{t-m})\varepsilon_{l}}\\ {\ell_{t}=s_{t-m}+\gamma(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1}+s_{t-m})\varepsilon_{t}}\end{array}\)

  1. ETS(ANM)

  2. ETS(AAdN)

  3. ETS(MAA)

  4. ETS(MNN)

Write down in the solution the sequence of numbers without spaces or delimeters corresponding to the formulas for the ETS models in each case (e.g. 4231).

Consider ETS(AAdN) model with \(\ell_0 = 90, b0 = 10, \phi=0.9, \alpha=0.1,\beta=0.2,\sigma^2=10\). We know that \(y_1=100\).

Find smoothed value \(\ell_1\).

Provide the answer with 2 decimal digits.

generalfeedback.text: Plug everything in a model and derive \(\ell_1\).

questiontext.text:
Consider ETS(MAM) with \(\alpha=0.1, \beta=0.3, \gamma=0.2, \sigma^2=0.5, l_T = 10, b_T = 1, s_{T} = 0.1, s_{T-1} = 0.5, s_{T-2} = -0.1, s_{T-3} = -0.5\) and quarterly seasonality

\(\begin{array}{l c r}{{y_{t}=(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1})s_{t-m}(1+\varepsilon_{t})}}\\ {{\ell_{t}=(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1})(1+\alpha\varepsilon_{t})}}\\ {{b_{t}=b_{t-1}+\beta(\ell_{t-1}+b_{t-1})\varepsilon_{t}}}\\ {{s_{t}=s_{t-m}(1+\gamma\varepsilon_{t})}}\end{array}\)

Construct a point forecast 2 steps ahead.

Consider gas dataset. Estimate ETS model without a trend and automatically selected error and seasonality specification. Provide initial state for trend component as an answer. Provide the answer with 2 decimal digits.

You can load the gas dataset in R by importing forecast library or if you use other programming languages you can download it here.

Consider gas dataset. Estimate ETS model without a trend and automatically selected error and seasonality specification. Calculate point forecast 2 years ahead. Provide the answer with 2 decimal digits.

You can load the gas dataset in R by importing forecast library or if you use other programming languages you can download it here.
